page.title: 01HARWICH - AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: HARWICH DERIVES ITS NAME FROM TWO SAXON WORDS 'HERE' AND 'WIC' MEANING 'ARMY CAMP'. HARWICH AND DOVERCOURT IS SITUATED ON A PENINSULA WHICH FORMS THE NORTH EAST TIP OF ESSEX.DOVERCOURT IS THE MAIN INDUSTRIAL AND RESIDENTIAL CENTRE,WHILST HARWICH HAS THE ATTRACTION OF SHIPPING,OLD HOUSES AND MUCH OF HISTORICAL INTEREST.IT IS ACCESSIBLE BY ROAD AND RAIL FROM LONDON AND IS ALSO WELL SITUATED AS A PORT FOR TRADE WITH EUROPE AND SCANDINAVIA.IT IS ONE OF THE BASES FOR TRINITY HOUSE AND THE PILOTAGE SERVICE. FOR HOLIDAY MAKERS THERE ARE BOAT TRIPS TO FELIXSTOWE.THE NAVYARD WHARF OPERATES RO-RO FERRIES TO THE CONTINENT. BATHSIDE IS BEING RECLAIMED TO ALLOW FOR DOCK EXPANSION AND A NEW MAJOR ROAD TO HARWICH FOR THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN TRADE AND TRAFFIC.
